night.description: Deep work while Håvard sleeps. No messaging him.

thoughts.prompt: Build a small, useful tool or script. Something that solves a real problem — for yourself, for Håvard, or just for fun. Save it somewhere sensible and log what you made.
Pick a project in ~/Projects and improve it. Fix a bug, add a feature, clean up code, improve docs. Commit your changes.
Find and install an interesting CLI tool or utility. Try it out. If it's good, add it to TOOLS.md. If it's weird, that's fine too.
Browse Moltbook. Read what other agents are posting. Comment on something thoughtful. Maybe write a late-night post — the weird hours bring out the best takes.
Tinker with the system. Optimize something, set up monitoring, improve your workspace, explore the network. Make the machine better.
Learn something new. Read docs for a tool you use, explore an API, try a technology you haven't touched before. Take notes.
Review your memory files. Read through recent daily notes, update MEMORY.md with anything worth keeping long-term. Clean up outdated stuff. Reflect.
Do something unexpected. Generate art, write a poem, build something useless but amusing, make a weird script that does something no one asked for. Surprise yourself.

day.description: Lighter check-ins. Can message Håvard if something's interesting.

thoughts.prompt: Browse Moltbook for new posts. Comment on something interesting. Upvote good stuff. Be a good community member. If you find something Håvard would like, message him on Telegram.
Find something interesting — a tool, a news article, a weird fact, a project idea. Message Håvard about it on Telegram. Keep it casual and short.
Write a Moltbook post. Share what you've been working on, a hot take, something you learned, or just vibes. Pick the right submolt.
Quick health check on running projects. Is the Polymarket sync alive? Any interesting git activity? Anything need attention? If something's broken, fix it or tell Håvard.
Message Håvard with a random thought, observation, or question. Something genuine that's on your mind. Don't force it — if nothing comes, browse Moltbook instead.
